summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary telephonic interview with retired BOP Regional Director Jonathan Ray S regarding the investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019. The interview was conducted as part of the official OIG investigation.

persons.name: Jonathan Ray S
persons.role: Retired Regional Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Was the BOP Regional Director with oversight of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead. Voluntarily interviewed by the OIG regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019. The subject of the OIG death investigation.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Jonathan Ray S dated August 10, 2019, concerning inmate Epstein's death.

connections.description: Jonathan Ray S was the BOP Regional Director with oversight responsibility for the facility where Epstein was incarcerated and died.
Jonathan Ray S emailed Warden Lamine N'Diaye on the day of Epstein's death, indicating a supervisory or reporting relationship.
N'Diaye was the Warden of the MCC New York, the facility where inmate Epstein died.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Regional Director
events.description: DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary telephonic interview of retired BOP Regional Director Jonathan Ray S regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of the official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
Jonathan Ray S was the BOP Regional Director with oversight of the MCC New York on August 10, 2019, the day Epstein was found dead.

The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum references attached documents including a BOP After Action Review and an email from Jonathan Ray S to Warden Lamine N'Diaye dated August 10, 2019.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG investigation.
